Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Download count decreased for the VaultSharp package" (#7986) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Bug Description
The download count for the VaultSharp package decreased in the last week, from 821,000 odd to 789,000 odd.

### To Reproduce
1. On this URL https://www.nuget.org/packages/VaultSharp/ see the download count. 

### Expected behavior
Download count should be around 821,000 odd. I don't have a screenshot for it, but that was the count 2 days ago. The download count it shows is 789,000 odd. 

### Additional context
It seems like the count got reset to a value that belonged to last week. The reduced number seems very familiar.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[A11y]Narrator is reading improper role for Expand/Collapse button" (#7889) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Copied from https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1069656
Repro Steps:​
1.Start Screen Reader. Hit the URL "https://www.nuget.org" and sign in with valid credentials​
2.Tab till the user menu button and press enter to expand it. Select "Manage Packages" and press enter​
3.Tab till "Published Packages", expand it and select any existing package.(If no packages are available, add a new package)​
4.Tab till "Manage Package" link under "Info" and press enter​
5.Tab till "Deprecation" section, enter required details, tab till "Save" button and press enter​
6.Tab till the package name in breadcrumb navigation and press enter​
7.Navigate to https://www.nuget.org/packages/DeltaX.fabel/​
8.Tab till the expand button present for the alert message that is displayed below the page heading​
9.Verify if the screen reader is reading the proper role for Expand/Collapse button​
​
Actual Result:​
Narrator is reading the Expand/Collapse button as "Group"
​
NOTE: NVDA is reading the role as button but it is not announcing the state(expanded/collapsed)

Expected Result:​
Narrator should read the role as button. Also, Narrator should read the state of the expand/collapse button, e.g.: button Expanded

Notes:
Giving this element a role="button" attribute seems to fix this issue.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "NuGet.org - Api key is generated/copied with the local culture that contains 'ı'" (#7961) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### For issues regarding the NuGet client tools (the Visual Studio extension, NuGet.exe command line tool, etc.), file a bug on [NuGet Home](https://github.com/nuget/home/issues).

### For issues connecting to NuGet.org, please refer to [this guide](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/faqs/nuget-faq#nugetorg-not-accessible).

### For issues regarding your NuGet.org account, please refer to [this guide](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/faqs/nuget-faq#nugetorg-account-management).

### Describe the bug
I am using Nuget.Org Api Key generation to connect and publish my NuGet packages from Azure DevOps. I had noticed earlier that i needed to generate the api key multiple times in order to get it to work and now when i pasted the api key somewhere it was containing the character 'ı' which is the Turkish variant of 'i'. I believe your key generation/copy logic is not working culture invariant and those keys do not work.

### To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Use a PC that is using Turkish culture.
2. Go to 'https://www.nuget.org/account/apikeys'
3. Generate a new Api Key.
4. Copy/Paste somewhere the generated key and see if it contains the character 'ı'. If not, generate a new key until you receive one key with 'ı'.
5. Try the generated key and see that it is not working.

### Expected behavior
Generated api keys should work irrespective of client culture.

### Screenshots
None

### Additional context
None

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[A11y]"Learn more" link is not descriptive." (#7879) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Copied from https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1062807
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Hit the #URL:https://www.nuget.org/
2. Navigate to "Sign in" control and hit enter.
3. Navigate to "Sign in with Microsoft" control and hit enter.
4. Select “Manage Organizations” from the Profile Dropdown and hit enter.
5. Navigate to "Add New" control and hit enter.
6. Turn on narrator, navigate to "Learn" more link using Tab key.
7. Observe Narrator announcement.

Actual:
Narrator not announces "Learn More" link in descriptive. 
When "Learn More" link receives Narrator focus it does not describe what the learn more link means.

Same issue is Observed in "Chrome+NVDA" also.

Same issue is Observed for controls "Learn More" and "Read More" in  Scenario "UploadPackage_Verify". Below is the screenshot.
Image
Expected:
The narrator should announce a short description about the learn more link.

Notes:
Not exactly sure what is expected to be announced here since "Learn more" is already in the context of the organizations page. We could update the "Learn More" link to include an aria-label with the text "Learn more about organizations on NuGet.Org"

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[A11y]'MIT' Link is not descriptive." (#7882) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Copied from https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1063680
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Hit the URL: https://www.nuget.org/
2. Navigate to "Sign in" control and hit enter.
3. Navigate to "Sign in with Microsoft" control and hit enter.
4. Search for a key term (say “json”) from search box.
5. Click on "Newtonsoft.json" control and hit enter.
6. Navigate to "Info" and "Statistics" section present on right of the screen.
7. Start the Narrator.
8. Navigate to "MIT" link under info.
9. Observe the Narrator announces the "MIT" link descriptively or not.
 
Actual:
Narrator is not announcing the proper description of 'MIT' link.

Similar issue has been observed with Chrome+NVDA

Expected:
The narrator should announce the description of the link.

Notes:
Context may be lost here that 'MIT' is actually descriptive of the license type. We should add an aria-label indicating "License type: MIT" or something similar.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[A11y]Focus is not visible on the expand/collapse button" (#7885) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Copied from https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1069655
Repro Steps:​
1.Hit the URL "https://www.nuget.org" and sign in with valid credentials​
2.Tab till the user menu button and press enter to expand it. Select "Manage Packages" and press enter​
3.Tab till "Published Packages", expand it and select any existing package.(If no packages are available, add a new package)​
4.Tab till "Manage Package" link under "Info" and press enter​
5.Tab till "Deprecation" section, enter required details, tab till "Save" button and press enter​
6.Tab till the package name in breadcrumb navigation and press enter​
7.Navigate to https://www.nuget.org/packages/DeltaX.fabel/​
8.Tab till the expand button present for the alert message that is displayed below the page heading​
9.Verify if the focus is visible on the Expand/Collapse button​
​
Actual Result:​
Focus is not visible on the expand/collapse button​
​
Expected Result:​
Focus should be clearly visible on the expand/collapse button​

Notes:
We will need to add some stuff in our CSS for the deprecation container focus outline. The current appears to be overridden to be non-existent.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[A11y]Narrator does not announce the error message "At least one scope must be selected" after unchecking the 'Push' button." (#7876) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Copied from https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1062059

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch application URL:https://www.nuget.org/
2. Navigate to "Sign in" control and hit enter.
3. Navigate to "Sign in with Microsoft" control and hit enter.
4. Select “API Keys” from the Profile Dropdown and hit enter.
5. "API Keys" screen gets opened.
6. Navigate to create button expand it.
7. Start the Narrator.
8. Navigate to  'push' check box and press enter.
9. Observe the error message "At least one scope must be selected" is  announced by the
  screen reader or not.

Actual:
Narrator does not announce error message(At least one scope must be selected) after unchecking the 'Push' checkbox.

Same issue observed for the below scenario.
1.Upload Package_Custom
1. Hit the URL:https://www.nuget.org/
2. Navigate to "Sign in" control and hit enter.
3. Navigate to "Sign in with Microsoft" control and hit enter.
4. Select “Upload Package” from the Profile Dropdown and hit enter.
5. Navigate to "Custom" control and hit enter.
6. Start the screen reader
7. Navigate to "preview" button with out filling any data and hit enter.
8. Observe that screen reader does not announces the below mentioned error.
Image

2.Upload Package_Url
1. Hit the URL:https://www.nuget.org/
2. Navigate to "Sign in" control and hit enter.
3. Navigate to "Sign in with Microsoft" control and hit enter.
4. Select “Upload Package” from the Profile Dropdown and hit enter.
5. Navigate to "Url" control and hit enter.
6. Start the screen reader
7. Navigate to "preview" button with out filling any data and hit enter.
8. Observe that screen reader does not announces the below mentioned error.
Image

3.Upload Package_Files
1. Hit the URL:https://www.nuget.org/
2. Navigate to "Sign in" control and hit enter.
3. Navigate to "Sign in with Microsoft" control and hit enter.
4. Select “Upload Package” from the Profile Dropdown and hit enter.
5. Navigate to "Files" control and hit enter.
6. Start the screen reader
7. Navigate to "preview" button with out filling any data and hit enter.
8. Observe that screen reader does not announces the below mentioned error.
Image

Expected:
 Narrator should announce the error message(At least one scope must be selected) after unchecking the 'Push' checkbox.

Notes:
Should be fixed by adding proper aria-live tags to region where error message will be displayed.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[A11y]Narrator is not reading the labels for "Select Version(s)" drop-down and "Select reason(s)" check-box group" (#7888) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Copied from https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1069752
Repro Steps:​
1.Start Screen Reader. Hit the URL "https://www.nuget.org" and sign in with valid credentials​
2.Tab till "Sign In" link in the top navigation and press enter​
3.Tab till "Sign in with Microsoft" button and press enter​
4.Select valid user id and press enter​
5.Enter any Username, tab till "Register" button and press enter​
6.Tab till the user menu button and press enter to expand it. Select "Manage Packages" and press enter​
7.Tab till "Published Packages", expand it and select any existing package.(If no packages are available, add a new package)​
8.Tab till "Manage Package" link under "Info" and press enter​
9.Tab till "Deprecation" section and press enter to expand it​
10.Tab till "Select Version(s)" drop-down and "Select reason(s)" and check if the screen reader is reading the associated labels​
​
Actual Result:​
Narrator is not reading the labels for "Select Version(s)" drop-down and "Select reason(s)" check-box group
​
NOTE: NVDA is also not reading the labels

Expected Result:​
Narrator and NVDA should read the labels for "Select Version(s)" drop-down and "Select reason(s)" check-box group

Notes:
First scenario seems fine. When drop down for Selected Versions is focused, narrator reads out Select Version. For Select Reason, each checkbox only has the description of the checkbox itself, not that is is part of selecting a reason. We can probalby update to "Select Reason etcetc" for this.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[A11y]Narrator unnecessarily announces the word expanded for the Cancel button." (#7878) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Copied from https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1062759

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Hit the #URL:https://www.nuget.org/
2. Navigate to "Sign in" control and hit enter.
3. Navigate to "Sign in with Microsoft" control and hit enter.
4. Select “API Keys” from the Profile Dropdown and hit enter.
5. Navigate to "Create" button and hit enter.
6. Enter Values in "Key Name" and "Glob Pattern" field and hit enter on Create button.
7. Navigate to "Manage" control and hit enter on "Edit" control.
8. Navigate to cancel button
9. Turn on the narrator 
10. Check if the narrator announces the cancel button correctly. 

Actual:
Narrator announces the name of the cancel button incorrectly. Narrator announces cancel button like "Cancel button expanded".  

Same issue is observed in chrome+NVDA

Similar issue has been observed in following:
1. Hit the URL: https://www.nuget.org/
2. Navigate to "Sign in" control and hit enter.
3. Navigate to "Sign in with Microsoft" control and hit enter.
4. Select “API Keys” from the Profile Dropdown and hit enter.
5. Navigate to "Create" button and hit enter, Select Push Checkbox.
6. "Select Packages" section gets enabled.
7. Navigate to 'Cancel' button and check the announcement by narrator.

Expected:
Narrator should not announce expanded along with cancel button.  
Narrator should announce only Cancel button.

Notes:
I was unable to reproduce the behaviour in the second scenario.
In the first scenario, the button gets the aria-expanded="true" attribute, which causes narrator to read it as expanded. However, in that case, the button is a collapser for the expanded dialog (from edit). Not 100% sure what we should do here. Removing aria-expanded="true" from the element will "fix" this bug, but I'm not convinced that this is the correct behaviour.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[A11y]The narrator announces same name for all 3 actionable images present under Owner section" (#7883) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Copied from https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1067633
Repro Steps:
1. Hit the URL:https://www.nuget.org/
2. Navigate to "Sign in" control and hit enter.
3. Navigate to "Sign in with Microsoft" control and hit enter.
4. Search for a key term (say “json”) from search box.
5. Click on "Newtonsoft.json" control and hit enter.
6. Navigate to "Owners" section present on bottom right of the screen.
7. Turn on the narrator.
8. Check if the narrator announces the correct name for all the 3 images in owner section.

Actual:
The narrator announces the same name like "gravatar" for all the 3 images under owner section.

Same issue is Observed in "NVDA" also.

Expected:
The narrator should announce the names of the 3 images differently as all the 3 images are actionable imags it should have different name.

Notes:
All 3 images in the describes owners section have alt text of 'gravatar'
I am not 100% sure if we can hijack the alt text here, but if we can, we could update the text to read as the owner.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[A11y]Incorrect name property provided for the "Custom" tab item." (#7884) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Copied from https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1069506
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Hit the URL:https://www.nuget.org/
2. Navigate to "Sign in" control and hit enter.
3. Navigate to "Sign in with Microsoft" control and hit enter.
4. Select “Upload Package” from the Profile Dropdown and hit enter.
5. Navigate to "Custom" control and hit enter.
6. Open AI4D.
7. Check name property for the "Cutom" tab item.

Actual:
For the "Custom" tab item, Incorrect name property provided. 

Expected:
For the "Custom" tab item, Name property should provided correctly and screen reader should announces the same.

Notes:
Looks like we set the name of this to "Enter readme in Markdown"
We can probably either change this to be "Custom Markdown" or "Custom" assuming that the context of this is sufficient. I lean towards not fix since this is more descriptive from a usability perspective.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Have ListPackages action accept only Get requests. Will now 404 deletes." (#7985) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Addresses https://github.com/nuget/engineering/issues/2866

The default action for packages is method agnostic and can be scoped to Get to fix this.

Note that this will cause a 404 to be returned, and I'll start a discussion on this solution. We can return something more customized if desired (and mentioned in the issue).

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Update max supported nuget client version" (#7984) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: See https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/pull/7982

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Detect max supported client version automatically" (#7983) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
## Problem
The NuGetGallery must be updated to reflect the latest NuGet client version each time the NuGet client publishes a new version. For example: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/pull/7982

## Solution

We could detect the max version automatically from the `tools.json` endpoint. This was suggested by @joelverhagen: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/pull/7982#discussion_r421835628

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Update max supported nuget client version" (#7982) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: Brings parity with: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Services.Index/pull/166

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "dotnet nuget push fails with -ss & -sk flags when using snupkg symbol format" (#9543) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
NuGet product used: `dotnet.exe`
dotnet.exe --version: `3.1.201`
OS version: `Win10 v1909 (18363.815) / Linux Latest on GitHub actions`
Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version: `No`

1. Run `dotnet pack --include-symbols -p:SymbolPackageFormat=snupkg -c Release Core.csproj`
2. Generates `Core.1.0.0.nupkg` & `Core.1.0.0.snupkg`
3. Run `dotnet nuget push *.nupkg -s https://mynuget.org/v3/index.json -k xxxx -ss https://mynuget.org/v3/index.json -sk xxxx --skip-duplicate`
4. Throws an error `File does not exist (*.symbols.nupkg).`

FYR
https://github.com/AraHaan/GitInformation/runs/651127299#step:5:67

`dotnet nuget push` seems to look for `.snupkg` by default but when using `-ss` & `-sk` flags to specify a different source for symbols it looks for `symbols.nupkg` instead & causes the error

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "NuGet cannot restore from HTTPS sources that require Client Certificates" (#5773) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Idea
---
We should add a way for users to nominate a Client Certificate for HTTPS connections that require them.

Probably should be handled simliar to https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/4387

"Inspirations"
---
npm has this: [https://docs.npmjs.com/misc/config#cert](url)
```
cert="-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----\nXXXX\nXXXX\n-----END CERTIFICATE-----"
```

maven has this: [https://maven.apache.org/guides/mini/guide-repository-ssl.html](url):
```
-Djavax.net.ssl.keyStore=/home/directory/mycertificate.p12
-Djavax.net.ssl.keyStoreType=pkcs12
-Djavax.net.ssl.keyStorePassword=XXXXXX"
```

Current Behavior
---
```
nuget list -source https://secured-server/repository/dev-nuget-feed -Verbosity Detailed
System.AggregateException: One or more errors occurred. ---> System.Net.WebException: The request was aborted: Could not create SSL/TLS secure channel
at System.Net.HttpWebRequest.GetResponse()
at NuGet.RequestHelper.GetResponse()
at NuGet.HttpClient.GetResponse()
at NuGet.RedirectedHttpClient.GetResponseUri(HttpClient client)
at NuGet.RedirectedHttpClient.EnsureClient()
at System.Lazy`1.CreateValue()
at System.Lazy`1.LazyInitValue()
at System.Lazy`1.get_Value()
at NuGet.MemoryCache.GetOrAdd[T](Object cacheKey, Func`1 factory, TimeSpan expiration, Boolean absoluteExpiration)
at NuGet.RedirectedHttpClient.get_CachedClient()
at NuGet.RedirectedHttpClient.get_Uri()
at NuGet.DataServicePackageRepository.get_Source()
at NuGet.Protocol.Core.v2.ListCommandResourceV2Provider.<TryCreate>d__1.MoveNext()
--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.ThrowForNonSuccess(Task task)
at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
at NuGet.Protocol.Core.Types.SourceRepository.<GetResourceAsync>d__11`1.MoveNext()
--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.ThrowForNonSuccess(Task task)
at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
at NuGet.Protocol.Core.Types.SourceRepository.<GetResourceAsync>d__10`1.MoveNext()
--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.ThrowForNonSuccess(Task task)
at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
at NuGet.Commands.ListCommand.<GetListEndpointsAsync>d__21.MoveNext()
--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.ThrowForNonSuccess(Task task)
at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
at NuGet.Commands.ListCommand.<ExecuteCommandAsync>d__22.MoveNext()
--- End of inner exception stack trace ---
at System.Threading.Tasks.Task.ThrowIfExceptional(Boolean includeTaskCanceledExceptions)
at System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Wait(Int32 millisecondsTimeout, CancellationToken cancellationToken)
at NuGet.CommandLine.Command.Execute()
at NuGet.CommandLine.Program.MainCore(String workingDirectory, String[] args)

```

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "nuget pack for an sdk style csproj that has a package ref does not create a package that lists that ref as a dependency" (#9276) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

Nuget pack task in devops build pipeline

NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx): 4.9.4

netfx461

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version: IDK

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

I have a netfx461 project (call it  "P") that has nuget package ("NP") installed into it as a package reference. The project format is an SDK style format and uses package reference as the nuget style.

A devops build pipeline  has a nuget pack task that packs the csproj.

The package ("PP") that is created is packed correctly except that there is no mention of NP anywhere in it as a dependency. 

If I consume that package in a program it does not install NP as well, though it means that there will be compilation failures if the code from PP is used in the project. 

I expect that the dependency NP will be listed in PP.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "packages element with xmlns set makes the nuget discover process find nothing." (#9185) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
NuGet product used (Package Manager Console):Package Manager Console

NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx):Package Manager Console Host Version 5.4.0.6292

dotnet.exe --version (if appropriate):

VS version (if appropriate): VS2019 Community Edition

OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)):Win 10

---------------------

1. with a nuget based web project there is a packages.config file produced. PackagesReferences are not allowed on this project type.

2. My packages.config file has been altered to give this front tag:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<packages xmlns="urn:packages">
... <package id=...  references inside in the normal way. >
</packages>

2. Using the xmlns attribute/property removes the nag of the message: "The packages element is not declared" in build output.

3. Unfortunately this breaks the ability to detect packages in the project for nuget.

Q: Could you fix the detector part of the code to ignore the inner attributes of the "packages" tag.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Cann't load DSM." (#9139) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Windows 10, VS2017, WinformsSample1

code fails at Form1.cs, line 46
 `this._twainx.OpenDSM();`

Cann't load DSM.  dialog appears.  Can't run progam.

(Also the English contraction "can not" is spelled "can't" - just 1 'n')

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "TreatSpecificWarningsAsErrors support for NuGet warnings" (#8797) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Original: https://github.com/dotnet/project-system/issues/5562.

(Opened on behalf of https://github.com/arialdomartini)

**Visual Studio Version**:

VS2019, Rider 2019.2.2, Command Line

```bash
$ dotnet --info
.NET Core SDK (reflecting any global.json):
 Version:   3.0.100
 Commit:    04339c3a26

Runtime Environment:
 OS Name:     Windows
 OS Version:  10.0.17134
 OS Platform: Windows
 RID:         win10-x64
 Base Path:   C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\3.0.100\

Host (useful for support):
  Version: 3.0.0
  Commit:  7d57652f33

.NET Core SDKs installed:
  2.0.3 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
  2.1.2 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
  2.1.4 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
  2.1.100 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
  2.1.201 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
  2.1.202 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
  2.1.302 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
  2.1.500 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
  2.1.502 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
  2.1.509 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
  2.1.801 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
  2.1.802 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
  2.2.103 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
  2.2.104 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
  2.2.402 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
  3.0.100 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]

.NET Core runtimes installed:
  Microsoft.AspNetCore.All 2.1.2 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.All]
  Microsoft.AspNetCore.All 2.1.6 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.All]
  Microsoft.AspNetCore.All 2.1.12 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.All]
  Microsoft.AspNetCore.All 2.1.13 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.All]
  Microsoft.AspNetCore.All 2.2.1 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.All]
  Microsoft.AspNetCore.All 2.2.2 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.All]
  Microsoft.AspNetCore.All 2.2.7 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.All]
  Microsoft.AspNetCore.App 2.1.2 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.App]
  Microsoft.AspNetCore.App 2.1.6 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.App]
  Microsoft.AspNetCore.App 2.1.12 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.App]
  Microsoft.AspNetCore.App 2.1.13 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.App]
  Microsoft.AspNetCore.App 2.2.1 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.App]
  Microsoft.AspNetCore.App 2.2.2 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.App]
  Microsoft.AspNetCore.App 2.2.7 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.App]
  Microsoft.AspNetCore.App 3.0.0 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.App]
  Microsoft.NETCore.App 2.0.3 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App]
  Microsoft.NETCore.App 2.0.5 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App]
  Microsoft.NETCore.App 2.0.7 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App]
  Microsoft.NETCore.App 2.0.9 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App]
  Microsoft.NETCore.App 2.1.2 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App]
  Microsoft.NETCore.App 2.1.6 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App]
  Microsoft.NETCore.App 2.1.12 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App]
  Microsoft.NETCore.App 2.1.13 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App]
  Microsoft.NETCore.App 2.2.1 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App]
  Microsoft.NETCore.App 2.2.2 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App]
  Microsoft.NETCore.App 2.2.7 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App]
  Microsoft.NETCore.App 3.0.0 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App]
  Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App 3.0.0 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App]

To install additional .NET Core runtimes or SDKs:
  https://aka.ms/dotnet-download
```

**Summary**:

csproj's directives like  

```xml
<NoWarn>
    NU1702
</NoWarn>
``` 
and 

```xml
<WarningsAsErrors>
    NU1702;1702
</WarningsAsErrors>
``` 

are ignored by `dotnet build`.

**Steps to Reproduce**:

1. Create a solution.
2. Create a `netcoreapp2.0` or a `netcoreapp3.0` project `A`
3. Create a class library targeting `net472` called `B`
4. Edit `A`'s csproj and add to it:

```xml
<PropertyGroup>
    <TreatWarningsAsErrors>True</TreatWarningsAsErrors>
    <WarningsAsErrors>NU1702</WarningsAsErrors>
</PropertyGroup>
```

5. Reference `B` from `A`
6. Compile the solution with `dotnet build`

**Expected Behavior**:
A compilation error. 

**Actual Behavior**:
The compilation succeeds, with a warning `NU1702`, which is not treated as an error.


**Additional notes**:

The reference from NetCoreApp to .NET 4.7.2 project raises a `NU1702` warning, which should be treated as an error, given the directive:

```xml
<PropertyGroup>
    <WarningsAsErrors>NU1702</WarningsAsErrors>
</PropertyGroup>
```
I also tried with 

```xml
<PropertyGroup>
        <TreatSpecificWarningsAsErrors>NU1702;1702</TreatSpecificWarningsAsErrors>
</PropertyGroup>
```
and

```xml
<PropertyGroup>
        <TreatSpecificWarningsAsErrors>NU1702;1702</TreatSpecificWarningsAsErrors>
</PropertyGroup>
```
and even by placing those directives in the `PropertyGroup` node where `<TargetFramework>` is. 




Possible related issues:

* [Cannot disable NuGet warnings with dotnet 2.0](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/5769)
* [TreatSpecificWarningsAsErrors does not work](https://github.com/dotnet/cli/issues/6485)
* [Framework Conditioned warning properties are not respected for multi-targeting projects](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/5712)
* [Suppressing warnings through project properties UI adds tfm condition in csproj file for multi targeting project](https://github.com/dotnet/project-system/issues/2804)
* [Nuget restore build task ignores `NoWarn` usage](https://github.com/microsoft/azure-pipelines-tasks/issues/5494)

* [TreatSpecificWarningsAsErrors does not work](https://github.com/dotnet/cli/issues/6485)

I noticed different behaviors depending on:

* `B` being referenced as a project in the same solution
* `B` being referenced as a NuGet package
* `B` being using the classic csproj file format vs the new SDK csproj format

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Deprecating TLS 1.0 and 1.1 on NuGet.org – Stage 1" (#42) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
## NuGet.org will temporarily remove support for TLS 1.0/1.1 on February 26, 2020

We plan to temporarily remove support for TLS 1.0/1.1 across 3 time slots in a 24 hour period, for 4 hours each, to ensure overlap with normal working hours across the globe. If you discover that you are impacted and cannot identify a workaround, please open an issue on the NuGet Gallery GitHub repo.

Read this blog post to learn more and to identify the test slot time in your time zone - https://devblogs.microsoft.com/nuget/deprecating-tls-1-0-and-1-1-on-nuget-org-stage-1/
